instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00875: What is 820-00875? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP5V_S5: What is PP5V_S5? This is a 5v power rail that is present when the machine is in an S5 soft off state..
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.P3V3_S5_EN: What is P3V3_S5_EN? P3V3_S5_EN is a typo of P3V3S5_EN which is a signal that enables the power chip responsible for creating PP3V3_S5. .
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00875</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Liquid damage missing <SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
As always lets start with a bit history. It might be helpful.

Originally it had damaged usb port due to liquid (replaced the ports), and damaged <CHIP>U7650</CHIP> (might have been good but since there was some corrosion on pin 23 i replaced it)

Currently i get 19.4V 0.02A on both ports

<SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL> - 0V
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> - 13.07V

<SIGNAL>P5P3V3_VREG3</SIGNAL> - 3.3V
<SIGNAL>P3V3S5_DRVH_R</SIGNAL> - 0V
<SIGNAL>P3V3S5_RF</SIGNAL> - 0V
<SIGNAL>P3V3_S5_EN</SIGNAL> - 0V

<SIGNAL>PP5V_LDO5V</SIGNAL> - 5.05V
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_LDO3V</SIGNAL> - 3.3V
<SIGNAL>PP1V25_VREF</SIGNAL> - 1.249V
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_PMIC</SIGNAL> - 13.07V
<SIGNAL>PMIC_EN3V3SW</SIGNAL> - 0.05V
<SIGNAL>PM_PGOOD_P5VS4</SIGNAL> - 0.05V

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00875</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Liquid damage missing <SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
Check diode mode to ground on all coils; compare with good board.
Pay atention to L7670/90.
Post <CHIP>U7890</CHIP> voltages.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00875</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Liquid damage missing <SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
The first coil i measured happened to be on <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> and it's shorted to ground.
Injecting 3 volts the small DIE on the CPU gets hot immediately. 
I guess i am just unlucky with these..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00875</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Liquid damage missing <SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL>
threads.message: Yeah, dead PCH; the board is trash now...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00875</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Liquid damage missing <SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL>
threads.message: If I manage to find a donor with a working CPU is it worth swapping it?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00875</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Liquid damage missing <SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
00840/875 boards are garbage.
Do not waste such a time...
